SEARCH

Class Item

java.lang.Object
Item
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Item extends Object implements Serializable
Represents an item in the inventory. Items can be food or gifts. Insert these objects into the inventory class.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Item

      public Item(String itemName, String itemType, int scoreIncrease) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Creates a new, unique item. Should be a food or gift. Do not use this class if the item type already exists. For example, if there already exists a burger, don't create another "burger" item object. The quantity of this item is set to 0 by default. The gacha chance is set to 0 by default. To set a gacha chance, use the Gacha class.

      To use this class, create a new item object and insert it into the inventory class, using the inventory's addItem method. You can use the inventory method to change the various values of this item. You probably don't have to use the public methods in this class directly.

      To add this item to gacha, use the Gacha class. You can set the gacha chance of this item using the Gacha class.

      Parameters:
      itemName - - the unique name of the item (e.g. burger).
      itemType - - the type of the item. Must be "food" or "gift".
      scoreIncrease - - how much of a stat bonus this item gives. Must be a positive integer between 0 and 100.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the score increase is not between 0 and 100, or if the quantity is not a positive integer.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the type does not equal "food" or "gift"

    • updateQuantity

      public void updateQuantity(int value)
      Updates the quantity of this item by adding the specified value. If the resulting quantity is less than 0, it is set to 0.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to add to the current quantity. Can be positive or negative.

    • hasItem

      public boolean hasItem(String itemName)
      Returns true if the item has a quantity greater than 0.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the item to check
      Returns:
      true if the item has a quantity greater than 0, false otherwise
